author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: It's the same resolution as GameCube. 640x480.
author: Erik Schröder

text: Not exactly m8   ... The Wii version was upgraded to wide screen and 720p
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text:
Why are you even doing this? I know you're being cute, but in case you aren't.

Wii is 480p maximum and not native widescreen. That means the pixels are still 640x480, however the TV can stretch the image so the game appears to be widescreen, since the game renders more on screen. The video is still only 4:3 though.

Now stop being silly.
author: Erik Schröder

text: I'm not being silly m8 ... The Wiiu VC version is upscaled to even 1080 p ... Granted the native resolution is indeed 480p but there is still a significant difference
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: would be great but we need more a new metroid game
author: RealLoader

text: Wii games on Wii U are still 480p. The image is indeed upscaled to 1080p, but not the game's resolution. Playing Wii games on Wii U through HDMI is sharper than playing on Wii with component cables and letting the TV upscale it, but that's it.
author: Erik Schröder

text: Just get it on dolphin if you want 1080p

author: H enryuuki

text: Other M was a fun game .... But it felt like a letdown in comparison to the legend thats the Prime Trilogy ... The story was full of plotholes and don't forget our old friend Adam and his permission to use the Varia Suit and other items ... The character of Samus was degraded from bad ass bountyhunter to a emo ... So that was a big mistake ... That said however : I really enjoyed the gameplay and thought it was still a really fun game in that regard
author: Recht_voor_zijn_raap

text: You can enjoy it but this is bad, nothing wrong with that
author: Lucien Lachance

text:
Well, you clearly have no idea what Metroid is about. Other M strips away everything that made Metroid what is was (Full of isolation, desperation, and most importantly..MYSTERY). TN turned Samus from an intriguing badass, to a melo-dramatic emo child..."Uhhh, you don't get me..". And you can't say the game play makes up for that, because it doesn't.

The old adage applies here, less is more.

So, you're basically saying that the 2nd best game of the generation isn't very good. Sure, that might be your own opinion, but since almost everyone else agrees it's not a very good example of a 'bad game'.

author: Matt Badham

text: Just incase you aren't, Super Mario Galaxy is possibly one of the best games of the generation, in fact, it's recieved the 2nd highest reviews (metacritic average) of the generation. Skyward Sword is absolutely fantastic, the majority believe that it's the best Zelda game yet. Super Mario 3D Land isn't as amazing as galaxy, but it sure is fun, also recieving great reviews. And Mario Kart 7 is also great fun, though the Mario Kart formula stays almost identical unlike other Nintendo franchises.

author: sonideromex

text: This game had a certain feel to it that NO other game has ever had. Total immersion. It wasn't a few corridors and maybe an open room, it was a planet. It was inhabited, it had colour, it had life.  The music fit the overall tone of the areas, being ominous without being dark and depressing. Did Gears of War have this same quality? Heck no. Halo? Please. The Prime series is, well... prime.
